adrFormatAddress: 2 Hammarskjold Plaza, 866 2nd Ave 8th floor, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: I applied for a digital nomad visa to Portugal on August 9th, it is now December 13th and I have no visa or explanation as to what is going on.  The consulate requested further information from me on Oct 25th (since my data was outdated because it is taking so long), which I submitted immediately, and I still have no further information.  I followed all the guidelines and requirements for this type of visa and the websites all say it shouldn't take any longer than 45 days.  I've sent numerous emails now looking for an update, yet still have none. I can't even imagine what the hold up has been. Extremely disappointing!  If you're trying to get this type of visa, plan at least 6 months ahead (or more, since I don't yet have a visa!)

originalText.text: Absolutely worst consulate experience ever. Unhelpful and unreachable. They don’t follow through on their own timelines, the front desk of the building they are in are incredibly rude (though admittedly not their fault) and there is no way to get in touch with them. I regret planning a trip to Portugal.

text.text: Absolutely worst consulate experience ever. Unhelpful and unreachable. They don’t follow through on their own timelines, the front desk of the building they are in are incredibly rude (though admittedly not their fault) and there is no way to get in touch with them. I regret planning a trip to Portugal.

originalText.text: I have to admit that I was apprehensive about visiting this consulate office, but once I was met by Miguel Vilar at the front desk, all my fears melted away. Miguel was courteous, professional and made my passport renewal as easy as possible. I wish every place I went had such a conscientious staff. Obrigada!

text.text: I have to admit that I was apprehensive about visiting this consulate office, but once I was met by Miguel Vilar at the front desk, all my fears melted away. Miguel was courteous, professional and made my passport renewal as easy as possible. I wish every place I went had such a conscientious staff. Obrigada!

originalText.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the level of service that was provided to me today at the Consulate General of Portugal in New York. I will be applying for citizenship, and Miguel Vilar was extremely patient and knowledgeable about the various documents and paperwork I would need. As this is a very involved process, I truly appreciated his kindness and willingness to help. Well done and muito obrigada por tudo!

text.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the level of service that was provided to me today at the Consulate General of Portugal in New York. originalText.text:
I applied for a Schengen visa to Portugal over 4 weeks ago leaving to World Youth Day. There is no response till date from the embassy. I am scheduled to leave to Portugal in 3 days.

No one answers the phone. I tried to call every possible office, but no help for my visa.

Portugal is likely to be missing many tourists such as myself by making the visa experience over all very difficult and painful.

I really hope there will be some type of update for my visa situation.
